channel.title: AMF (Auxy Music Festival)
channel.description:
Ever since I joined Auxy about ten months ago, it seems the community has grown immensely. I want to thank everyone here for being such a great group of musicians with great ideas and the devs for making the best mobile DAW and one of the best DAWs of all time.
**BUT now, to take the community even further and connect us even more, I would like to propose that, as a community, we have an an _Auxy Music Festival_**.
I was thinking it would be awesome if this now-huge community had some kind of get-together to share our music with the community in person. My ideas are still pretty basic at this time, but what I came up with was a group of Auxy users taking turns at DJing simple, short sets (of their music and other music) and talking about music.
This is pretty far fetched as of now, but I do think it would be pretty sick if we could coordinate something in-person like @DHO mentioned about a real-life Auxy tournament or collab:
[quote="DHO, post:595, topic:10333, full:true"] Would anybody ever be interested in attending an in person Auxy Tournament? Not something I’m planning to organize for at least a few years, just wondering. [/quote]
Thanks for reading, everyone! eohr

item.title: AMF (Auxy Music Festival)
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah it’s been brought up a few times over the last few months or more. I still maintain everyone’s best bet is piggy backing some other local convention, it would be a safe, established venue with A LOT of other very interesting things going on too.

Read full topic

item.title: AMF (Auxy Music Festival)
item.dc:creator: Peregrihn
item.description:
I asked something like this

Auxy Convention Random
I don’t know if anyone has thought of this before but I’ve had an idea: Wouldn’t it be great if the community Extended to irl? Wouldn’t it be something if we could share concepts and tracks in real time face to face? Wouldn’ It be cool, when resources are available, to have an Auxy Convention? Thoughts?

Read full topic

item.title: AMF (Auxy Music Festival)
item.dc:creator: crystldawnmusic
item.description:
I think it’s a great idea, but as ICS said, there are logistical issues. For those of us that are younger, we’d have to get plane tickets, hotels, etc., and I’m sure some of our parents wouldn’t like the idea.

Read full topic

item.title: AMF (Auxy Music Festival)
item.dc:creator: facade
item.description:
If someone like @blackocean or @stereofield gets signed to a major label or gathers a fanbase of about 15k on SoundCloud, they’d probably be able to do this Auxy Music Festival. (I’m assuming they’d be making decent money off of music sales by then. Also, I’m using them for examples since they have connections with Phuture Collective and have releases on sublabels of Phuture. Anyone here could make it in the music industry. You just have to put in the time and energy.) It probably won’t happen for a while. It sounds like a good idea though. Hopefully we’ll all still stay part of the community if we set this future goal of having this festival. It definitely gives me motivation.

Read full topic

item.title: AMF (Auxy Music Festival)
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
A friend of mine organised something similar in our area.

He spoke to a local bar about taking over one of their quiet nights once a month, which they were happy to do, as we were getting 100+ people through the door.

People would send him their latest tracks, and he’d DJ for a few hours with a big ‘now playing’ screen behind him.

It wasn’t Auxy focussed, but it was a great networking event, as well as an excuse to have a beer with friends.

Read full topic
